answers.answer: Hello,< 125 is reasonable control, but it would also be good to know what is happening after you eat and what your Hba1c (average of 3 months blood sugar is).If your fasting is high, then I also suspect your post eating numbers are high.I would recommend you ask your Dr about medication such as metformin / Glucophage as it is better to get this very well controlled as early as possible.Do you have a home blood sugar meter?  If so, please test about 1 1/2  - 2 hours after eating and see what your numbers are.  Ideally they are < 140 all the time. If they are higher than 140 please discuss further with your drs.let us know how you go.

question: My blood sugar fastings have been under 125 for about 6 months now - average 110.  I am unsure if this is good control or if I need to be on medication.  I am not on any medication for diabetes at this time, but I do take Toprol and heard that Toprol also raises blood sugar.
title: Blood sugar fasting
